p: In the very past and present daysâ€™ folk medicines, selection of specific plant origin honeys for specific therapeutic purposes are widely used ( Molan, 1992), indicating all honeys may not have equal therapeutic values. In this regard, Iirish et al. (2011) reported that out of 477 honey samples tested only 57% of them have antimicrobial activities, and exceptionally strong antimicrobial properties observed only in honeys derived from three bee plants. The composition of active ingredients in plants depends on different factors, mainly plant bio and chemo-type and environmental situations ( Alvarez-Suarez et al., 2010b).
